channel.title: Listing methods with reflection
channel.description:
Was looking around and reading up on reflection and wrote this to put it to some use.
You just compile it and put the class in a directory then run it. Only goes through the .class in the same directory as MethodDump.class
I ran it on a deobbed 422 for fun and dumped to a file (Boat.txt). java -cp . MethodDump > C:\Boat.txt
Enjoy.
EDIT: Yeah, it lists the methods from MethodDump.class as well, didn't bother blocking that one. Oops. And I also didn't bother making it recursive, I was only messing around.
EDIT2: Tried it with the original client from runescape (rsjar.txt). Nice and confusing. heh

item.title: Listing methods with reflection
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

Hey, don’t rain on my parade. We gots candy and big balooooons.

I’m just messing around with reflection and found that part of it to be rather easy so decided to post in case someone else might benefit from my time. I was actually surprised with the amount of time it took to dump all of those to a file.

Directory: C:\Documents and Settings\sdouble\Desktop\rsclient

Classes: 129

Methods: 1128

Time: 591 ms

I expected it to take longer than that.

Read full topic

item.title: Listing methods with reflection
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Yep, reflection is cool…but you could always use the javap utility 

Compiled from "RSACracker.java"
public class RSACracker extends java.lang.Object implements java.lang.Runnable{
    public static final java.math.BigInteger encryptionExponent;
    public static final java.math.BigInteger modulusValue;
    public static void main(java.lang.String[]);
    public RSACracker();
    public void run();
    static {};
}

But nice job with your application - reflection can be very useful at times

Read full topic

item.title: Listing methods with reflection
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

By the way people downloading Boat.txt 12 times so far and MethodDump.java has been downloaded 3 times, this thread is about MethodDump, which is why I posted this in the Java Programming section instead of the “RuneScape Development” section. There is nothing in Boat.txt or rsjar.txt that is special at all, I apologize if you were looking for something useful.

I just used runescape as an example since there are a lot of classes and methods and I had it on my computer already.

Read full topic
